sub_title: International Teacher of History and Social Studies for Secondary Schools
summary:
I am currently seeking for opportunities in the field of education, specifically as a secondary (middle) school teacher specialising in History and Social Studies within international schools. Over the past four years, I have gained valuable experience while working in diverse international school environments across multiple countries, including Turkey, Spain, Portugal, and Luxembourg.

My passion for teaching and my expertise in History and Social Studies have allowed me to engage with students from various cultural backgrounds, fostering a dynamic and inclusive learning environment. I am committed to inspiring and empowering the next generation of global citizens through a student-centered approach to education.

In addition to my educational journey in teaching, I have a diverse background in Hotel Management (Bachelor's degree) and Human Resources (MBA), with extensive work experience in the Hostelry and Tourism sectors, both in Brazil and Israel.

Finally, I am fluent in four languages: English, Portuguese, Spanish and Hebrew.

I look forward to leverage my international experience and subject matter proficiency to contribute to the growth and success of an international school that values innovation, cultural diversity, and academic excellence.

education.field_of_study: Education - International Teacher Education for Secondary Schools (ITESS)

profile_positions.description:
During this three-month teaching practice, I had the opportunity to apply a range of pedagogical approaches that I acquired throughout my four years of study. I was eager to share my professional experiences and learn from my colleagues during this enriching experience.

At ISL, I was responsible for preparing and delivering lessons to two groups of grade 7 students and one group of grade 6 students. I conducted these teaching sessions under the supervision of my mentor teacher and the respective subject teachers of each class.

In addition to my role as a student teacher, I also conducted a field research project with a primary focus on investigating the alignment of the study of History with current affairs. The outcomes of this research demonstrated the potential benefits of integrating contemporary issues into the curriculum, particularly within the context of international education. The topic of the research was motivated by my preferred teaching style, which aims to engage students by connecting historical content to their personal lives and fostering citizenship awareness — a crucial aspect when educating global citizens.

Throughout the internship, I actively participated in various extracurricular activities. These included a field trip to Trier, Germany, participating in a basketball game between students and teachers, and attending a diversity awareness training conducted by ISL students.

This successful internship marked the culmination of four years of dedicated effort and continuous learning, ultimately shaping me into an international educator.

Skills developed during this internship:

- Full-time teacher for three different classes.
- Implemented several differentiation approaches, on instruction, process and product.
- Fostered critical thinking skills among students through a variety of activities and facilitated discussions. 
- Engaged actively in extracurricular activities
profile_positions.title: Student Teacher

profile_positions.description:
During my third internship, I gained valuable firsthand experience with working with a curriculum based on the British system. Teaching both middle school (Key Stage 8) and high school (Key Stage 10) students was a rewarding challenge. It allowed me to appreciate the distinctions between these two age groups, particularly in terms of student maturity and the pedagogical approach required, given that the older students were preparing for the IGCSE exams.

Throughout the two-month internship period, I actively engaged in lesson planning and delivery, all while benefiting from the guidance of my mentor teacher and the Key Stage 10 teacher. I also had the opportunity to implement effective pedagogical methods, such as the use of visuals to enhance students' comprehension of key concepts, particularly in the context of differentiated instruction. Over the course of the internship, I had the privilege of teaching four distinct groups, comprising two Key Stage 8 classes and two Key Stage 10 classes.

Additionally, this experience provided me with insights into managing diverse class sizes. The Key Stage 8 groups consisted of 9 students each, whereas the Key Stage 10 classes were larger, with slightly more than 20 students in each.

Skills I developed during this internship:

- Active planning of lessons tailored for both middle and high school students (with focus on preparing the latter group for the IGCSE exams).
- I successfully taught four different classes of both middle and high school.
- Engagement in extracurricular activities, including chaperoning a field trip.

profile_positions.description:
A complete two-month teaching practice at SEK El Castillo, an international school located in Madrid, Spain. During this intensive period, I took on various responsibilities that allowed me to gain valuable insights and develop a diverse set of skills in the field of education and, more specifically, as a teacher.

One of the highlights of my internship was the opportunity to independently plan and deliver full series of lessons to different groups of MYP 7 students, under the supervision of my mentor teacher. To engage my students effectively, I employed a range of pedagogical strategies, including active learning, differentiation, and an inclusive classroom approach. This experience reinforced the importance of building a strong rapport with the students, fostering a positive and conducive learning environment.

Despite the challenges posed by the Covid-19 pandemic, I was fortunate to have a full-time on-site internship experience while adhering to all safety guidelines in place at the time.

Skills Developed:

- Stepped in for absent teachers across various classes and grade levels.
- Successfully planned and executed diverse lessons and activities for four different MYP 7 groups.
- Applied pedagogical theories tailored to the unique needs of each MYP group, adapting my teaching style to maximize student engagement and learning outcomes.

profile_positions.description:
During my first teaching practice at an international school, I had the opportunity to observe and learn from various teachers, each employing unique teaching styles across different subjects. While I gained insights from a range of educators, my primary focus was on History and Geography, aligning with my field of expertise.

Throughout this teaching practice, I progressively took on more responsibilities, including independently planning and delivering complete lessons, all under the guidance and supervision of my mentor teacher. 

This hands-on experience allowed me to develop a diverse set of skills, including:

- Understanding the dynamics of an international school environment in Istanbul. 
- Crafting and executing lesson plans tailored to engage students effectively. 
- Implementing active learning strategies to foster a student-centered approach to education.
- Cultivating an awareness of teacher dynamics to promote a respectful and inclusive classroom environment.
